alert.note: Alert for Kay; Noble; Payne (Oklahoma) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Wind Chill Warning issued December 22 at 3:29AM CST until December 23 at 12:00PM CST by NWS Norman-Oklahoma City
info.description: ...WIND CHILL WARNING REMAINS IN EFFECT UNTIL NOON CST FRIDAY... ...WINTER WEATHER ADVISORY REMAINS IN EFFECT UNTIL NOON CST TODAY... * WHAT...For the Wind Chill Warning, dangerously cold wind chills. Wind chills as low as 25 below zero. For the Winter Weather Advisory, snow and blowing snow and local areas of freezing drizzle. Snow accumulations of up to one inch. Winds gusting as high as 45 mph. * WHERE...Kay, Noble and Payne Counties. * WHEN...For the Wind Chill Warning, until noon CST Friday. For the Winter Weather Advisory, until noon CST today. * IMPACTS...Plan on slippery road conditions. Areas of blowing snow could significantly reduce visibility. The hazardous conditions could impact the morning or evening commute. The cold wind chills could cause frostbite on exposed skin in as little as 30 minutes.
info.instruction: Avoid outside activities if possible. When outside, make sure you wear appropriate clothing, a hat, and gloves. Slow down and use caution while traveling. For the latest road conditions call 8 4 4 4 6 5 4 9 9 7.
